gTf2xvdXwO-_MC5-b0v2RA.text: Went for lunch with a colleague and had an amazing experience.   I had the smoked duck sandwich and the pink peppercorn peach cobbler for dessert.   Both were well balanced!  The depth of flavor had my taste buds singing. I looked at the dinner menu and I have to say I wish I could go back for the pan seared scallops.    However I will be back to enjoy the flavors that this gem is producing!

photos.caption: Photo of Virtù - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Smoked Duck Sandwich
Photo of Virtù - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The peach cobbler!!!

koYfThyQlyeg7CRcooab_g.text: Excellent food and service. Will definitely be returning for future special celebrations!  Must-order: - Octopus - Asparagus - Cornish Hen (slightly gamey, the brine adds incredible depth. good choice if you like chicken!) - Sticky toffee cake

fqlLUHLDr6KAgc1bxJ-HHA.text: 5 stars for ambiance (including a charming patio), food, and gelato offerings (try the perfect pistachio). 4 stars for attentive but not especially warm or friendly service. Still worth the trip and many return visits. No one has to be nice to me if the food & drinks are this good. :)

jcAAtLUlM90jPkV-g-cVZA.text: This is the best new restaurant that I've been to in 2014.  The decor, service and food are all excellent.  I sat at the bar and really enjoyed talking with Dante the bartender.  He was very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu.  I had the grilled asparagus appetizer and it was delicious with egg, feta and bacon candy.  My second dish was their signature grilled Spanish octopus.  This was presented beautifully and tasted wonderful.  The octopus was more tender than any I've ever eaten and seasoned perfectly.  I can't wait to come back for another meal and try their desserts.

flRP2yLNR8xiXOSB2KP2Sw.text: All around great experience. From the ambience to the delicious food. The octopus was by far the best I've ever had.

FZyHvMm0jaXhCNFEonydPw.text: This Mediterranean/Calabrian restaurant refreshes its menu every week with updated selections and fresh ingredients. We ordered 4 plates and all were terrific. Grilled Asparagus and salad with grilled radishes and turnips for starters. The entrees were pasta (with egg noodles) and scallops - the portions were on the smaller side but the food was perfectly seasoned and very rich so you felt just the right amount of satisfied. Look forward to returning to see what the menu looks like next time.

W34z632XnwbgxS8m0QMkRg.text: Virtu is a place where the food always surprises me, because no matter what I might think when I read the menu, it always comes together beautifully and deliciously.  You can really see and taste the attention to detail in each dish.  We've been for brunch during the weekdays as well as for dinner.  Their everyday brunch menu should not be missed!  Favorites from brunch:  noble bread French toast, pancakes, pork ragu, crepe.  The portions are great--we never leave hungry.  My husband had a fantastic duck entree, while I had squid ink pasta with octopus made to look like bolognese, which was a masterful play in texture, taste, and color.  Staff is attentive, friendly, and helpful!

A3t1TQdQm6bmRNerp7d2yA.text: We came here because it had 200 reviews and 4 1/2 stars for dessert only, but what we found was what we believe will be a superior dining experience in a quaint lil Bistro that you would find in Italy's rustic region. We had #1 &#3 on desert menu. One word to describe these two desserts, BOOM! Yes BOOM! In only a superior way. We will be coming back for diner before we head back to the East Coast.

photos.caption: Photo of Virtù - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Never had a chance!
Photo of Virtù - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. It&#39;s here!
Photo of Virtù - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Getting ready for the #1 &amp; #3 on the dessert menu

sou33rjRrBuNp4Vfut8CuA.text: I wanted to love Virtu and give it the 5 stars I heard it deserved. At best, I give it a 3.5.   1) wine list is not very deep. They play up their hand crafted cocktails, but their wine list is disappointing.  2) service was pretty disappointing on a weekend. Flat out disappointing.  3) octopus- fantastic.  4) main dishes: duck/steak- I love culinary flavor, however, the flavor profiles were not prepared in a way that I would describe as life changing.  I saw pictures, and think I need to give it another shot. I will return- and hopefully have a better report.

R9Oq6q49XAA6E6jwdry-mA.text: Gio has hit this out of the ballpark. The interior is impeccable, the setting is quaint and ideal for a restaurant of this caliber. Make a reso for dinner!  Enjoy the brunch ASAP!  While the wine list is limited and the food has a different approach that is precisely why you come here- step outside of our comfort zone of favorite foods and expand our horizons. The mixology is magical and the cuisine is dependably creative.

photos.caption: Photo of Virtù - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fabulously simple decor and a great use of copper accents.
Photo of Virtù - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Aside an intimate courtyard Virtu is full of charm.

97AhovsM68q3GjlnqvrTmQ.text: Virtu is a beautiful, intimate restaurant. I'd consider it one of the best in the valley. We go to virtu whenever there's something special to celebrate. You have to get the octopus, it always surprises us how amazing it is. They have a nice cocktail menu and mocktails as well. We always look forward to the next reason to celebrate. It's going to be an expensive dinner but that's ok- it's worth every penny. The staff is great, hey change out silverware between courses. Two big thumbs up.

gCPQj9vNYnd-LK1AJHpLbQ.text: We came here for my husband's birthday dinner. The receptionist who took our reservation was awesome. I'm vegetarian and she spent a lot of time explaining the menu making sure I had enough options to select. The food is good but not great and the service is pretty slow. We will probably give it one more chance before ruling it out completely.

Q78cSbGVTp-E7z_q8p1g-g.text: Place is legit.  Took wife for a rare night out. Sat outside on the patio, service was great. We split a bottle of wine and noshed on the burrita appetizer (done very well!) Wish we could have had a coupke crusty bread slices to finish off the Concord grape jam.  She had the white chocolate scallops, I had the orata  (bream) fish. Both cooked perfectly.  The scallops were probably the best of the 2 dishes, like A++ and A+  We spilt the budino dessert, nice presentation and flavor off the chart! Again, maybe I'm weird but would have loved sonething to dip in it... just me.  Then we walked to the rusty spur for some drinks and a uber home. Fun night  Great spot, going back soon as my wife and I can

6ejOCrS_CxvEc6O9lOjxSw.text: No doubt about it, cocktails are the way to go at Virtu. The food, however, is overpriced and sometimes underwhelming.  We arrived to a jam-packed restaurant Tuesday night. I was a bit surprised because it looked like there were plenty of open tables when I made reservations online a couple days prior. I could tell right away that they were in the weeds because of Restaurant Week so I prepared myself for a slower dining experience. We were fine waiting at the bar for our table. We love craft cocktails, and we loved checking out all the obscure liquors and house-made concoctions behind the bar. My husband got the Nuova Bellezza, a grape-based drink, and I got the Fountain of Youth. His drink was very good, and mine was outstanding! I swear, you could get any tequila hater to enjoy this cocktail made with Don Julio reposado and yellow bell pepper syrup. We also had the classic Sazerac and their Starter Kit which was refreshing and slightly bitter.  My husband got the chef starters which was a crostini, blistered peppers and a croqueta. He didn't really like any of them and much preferred my salad. The salad with beets and goat cheese was nice, but the warm temperature indicated it probably sat at the window too long. I got the only vegetarian offering which was a modified (no pancetta) version of butternut squash ravioli. When my dish came to the table, I spotted the pancetta right away and sent it back. In the mean time, my husband got his thick pork chop but no silverware. I gave him my set while I waited, but he was still in need of a steak knife. My redone ravioli came out again fairly quickly, but I had to ask for another set silverware. I was very disappointed looking at the ravioli. The portion was minuscule! Four Chef Boyardee sized goat cheese ravioli with just a touch of brown butter and no butternut squash at all. The ravioli were very good, but thank god I don't have a huge appetite. Surprisingly, the star of my husband's dish wasn't the prosciutto wrapped pork but the phenomenal mushrooms on the side. The pork was moist but didn't have much flavor. My husband said he would have rather had just the mushrooms on top of a risotto.   We finished off with the affogato and chocolate course for dessert. My husband wasn't a fan of the affogato, but I liked both of them. His chocolate mousse was light and fluffy, and there was a delightful, warm chocolate s'more-like pastry on the side.  Our server was friendly, but she forgot about filling up our water glasses. I was also dismayed that the staff let the restroom run out of hand towels. Nothing like walking back to your table with wet hands.  I could see us returning again for pre-dinner cocktails, but we'll be sticking with FnB nearby for our food.

OMf4IK5dzsvlYaOrBk78-Q.text: I tried grilled octopus, pork ragu & toffee cake. Everything was delicious. I wish my stomach was bigger than it already is. Service was excellent.

qHMm7KV0Lv_9XxQMUPk31A.text: Ordered a dish off the very descriptive menu without pine nuts as one of our party had a severe allergy.  Dish arrived with pine nuts.  When asked why this was not described on the menu, considering every other element of the dish was, the waitress informed us that it was our responsibility to inform her of any allergies.  She took the dish and charged us for it anyway!  We did not argue as we needed to leave urgently to get some benadryl.  The General Manager was informed and was non-responsive.  An otherwise beautiful evening ruined by horrible customer service and a general lack of concern for the "experience" part of dining.

uxZgrbCq9IjkSV2TB0haZg.text: Great patio. Had dinner here last night, cool weather, lanterns glowing in the trees, great place for drinks or dinner. We started with the foie gras hollandaise which is out of this world. Then on to crusted scallops and smoked duck both of which are delicious. Everything from the service to the food to the bill were perfect

JB80xRSmJNj1AULIChwhAg.text: We eat at many wonderful places for work dinners in several cities but this was bar none, the best experience and meal we have had. Courtney guided us through an incredible evening of the finest of everything. Looking forward to returning on my next trip out.

MAV5i1pceQUNKiftRzDwfA.text: The food, staff, & attention to innovative food  creation make this a must return to venue. After eating at  5 allegedly "top " Scottsdale restaurants this week,  Virtu  in comparison, makes the  5 "top" seem average. If Virtu keeps up their amazing creative effort- won't be able to get a table agin until next August!

Sj5tPzKP6su1_D8WA0qbuw.text: This was an exceptional dining experience.  The service and food were both top quality, this was one of the best meals I've ever experienced.  We started with the grilled asparagus, then followed with the butternut squash gnocchi, next was the smoked duck, and finished with two deserts, the butterscotch and the sticky pudding.    The gnocchi was a must  try, delicate pillows of delightfulness, surrounded with a gorgonzola cream sauce, topped with walnuts, pears and prosciutto.   The duck was cooked to perfection, we ordered medium as opposed to the recommended medium rare and it was delicious.   My first time here, I can't believe I've lived in the area for several years and not been to Virtu before.  I will be back, likely on my way to becoming a regular.

johnaOlDAXWKt7nFV04d-w.text: We have eaten at VIrtu several times.  The food is excellent.  This week it was for dinner, we had the grilled octopus, pasta and bruschetta with fresh mozzarella.  All simply wonderful.  The service was terrific.  The wine list is a bit limited - and very expensive.

aVpGKIUjXhuv0H5rz4tYlQ.text: We went because I'd heard good things about the cocktails. Although both the venue and the menu are much smaller than the other well-reputed cocktail bars in the valley (Crudo, Bitter & Twisted, etc) the quality is absolutely on par with those bars. A guy named Max took care of us, and rather than order off of the menu he made us multiple rounds of drinks of his own creation based on our likes and dislikes. He was spot on every time and was great company as well. We shared a few items off of the food menu, the best of which was the asparagus with duck egg. The kitchen was visible, which I always like.

oncE0OzC1EyDGgRLIMkvJQ.text: Fantastic dinner.....again. Octopus was fabulous as it was the first time I had it. But the Buratta with almond honey might have taken the cake for the starter which says a lot because I crave the Octopus. The pork Saltimboca was flat out ridiculous. I really thought with a brine and then prosciutto wrap would make it too salty, but it was far from that. It was perfect didn't need anything. The potatoes were unique because They looked like fries sauteed with veg, but the crispy leeks on top added the slight crunchy texture that helped break up the richness of everything else in dish. I'm a huge eater I think they could've dialed back the veg and potato on the dish. My date had the Carbonara. I'm not a fan of it because it's really a romantic dish. Although the ingredients are simple, it's the chef's relationship with the product that makes it amazing. This was one of the most fantastic I've ever tried. Did I like it? No. But the execution was perfect. There was a small but of white wine and very little cream and the egg created layers over and over. It wasn't swimming in sauce and I love that. Again, it was the execution of the dish that made it great. I just don't like carbonara.  I wasn't excited about the dessert menu but daddy needs his sugar. The affogato was tremendous, but the olive oil shortcake was brilliant. They macerated the strawberries with a touch of brand but it was more complimentary than predominant. But the cake was so incredible and super functional. I could be served with anything.  My only complaint would be where we sat. We were sat on the patio right next to a table that got sat exactly at the same time as us. They complained about everything and we were subjected to listen to them complain openly about everything, then complain to the server, and when he offered to redo or get them something else, they'd refuse and then sit there and complain again. Keep in mind that we sat at 5:15 and there was nobody else around. I'm happy they are busy, but sitting us next to people simultaneously in an empty restaurant makes it tough to be able to really enjoy your company. We literally were sharing our dining experience with them and their attitude and pettiness was really annoying.  Next time,  if they sit us next to a table at the same time, I will ask to be sat elsewhere and if the say no again, I will probably leave. But I won't dock them for it because what they are doing is special, but they also need to keep in mind that absolute no opens themselves up to negative reactions.

Vpgz62RPL3FHKVwNgaTQFQ.text: Yum! What a terrific little find! We are total foodies, in Scottsadale from San Francisco for the week, so of course had to see if the hype was True. It is! Great little place, lovely patio with heater lamps, terrific service & yes, everything else people are saying about the cocktails & food quality is not exaggerated. I decided to go the small plate route, thinking I'd order 2-3 appys instead of a main course to sample more things. But the portions were  quite large & two was plenty!  ( and I can eat!). I had the octopus ( charred to tasty perfection ) and the pork roulette (sp?) which was like a cold pate of sorts, with crostini & all sorts of interesting spreads & pickled yummies to add to it. I ended up dining alone this time, as my husband got stuck late at a conference. His loss! I was fully engrossed with my food, drink & the chatty staff for a good 2 hours & never even really noticed - LOL . Shhh! The place is really reasonably priced for the food quality, the wine list had many options under $12 & the like cocktails were tasty. Ask for patio seating if its a nice place. Highly recommend. Enjoy!

oOvpZdsZZq1sDbHvT8-LRw.text: I said I'd never, ever in a million years go back to Arizona, until Virtu. And, still, I'd only go back to dine and dash from the state as quickly as possible. Anyway, Virtu is incredible. We happened to stumble upon it during restaurant week. We ordered 2 of everything on the menu, and there wasn't one dish I wouldn't order again. It has a farm to table vibe; small, lite, quaint, and classy. We each ordered a crafted cocktail - I had the Ice Queen, which was great. Fruity. There was a Moscow Mule-esque drink that was fantastic. I think that my favorite dishes were the honey beets, there was a fish entree that was incredible, and the brandzino (unnnnnnnnnreal). I almost ready to book a flight back right now...

vvz0EQOlmBPLmJsiE2nciA.text: I was excited to try Virtu and finally did with my cousins today for brunch.  Walking up, you can't miss the outside patio with a nice ambiance.  It was a beautiful day, so we sat outside - unfortunately it got warm fast, so we moved inside.  Started with a Enza | Prosecco and a Apple cocktail from the drink list - which was perfectly made.  We ordered the berry parfait to start and it was okay - but, it was enough to share.  I ordered the frittate di pasta and they were kind enough to make it vegetarian, it came with a cup of fruit.  My cousin ordered the classic crepe and when it arrived, it was HUGE.  My other cousin ordered the smoked duck and she loved it!  So why only 3 stars?  I didn't enjoy my dish and my cousin didn't enjoy the crepe.  The skillet was pipping HOT, the food never cooled down, it just continued to release steam with each bite.  It was too bland and wouldn't order it again.  I left hunger unfortunately.  The crepe had a ton of ham, so if you like pork, this dish is for you.  Maybe dinner offers a better selection.

22T74tZFvR7Yb2HvTEpRqg.text: As other reviewers have said, the grilled octopus appetizer is very good. I also had the seared branzino entree and it was very good, too. Although the food was cooked well, the presentation of the dishes was a little bit over complicated for my taste. Every dish had a nest of a crispy fried garnish on it. I'm a little bit of a purist about quality ingredients like those used at Virtu; my philosophy is to "Keep It Simple, Stupid". The service, while knowledgable and accommodating, was quite slow; my dinner companions grew frustrated by the pace. I enjoy leisurely dining, though, so it was fine to me. The cocktails are definitely worth trying. I had a Let the Beet Drop and a Johnny Ringo's Epitaph, and both were unique and delicious. I'm torn here; while I definitely enjoyed my meal, I think I would have enjoyed simply grilled octopus and seared branzino even more at a number of different excellent Greek tavernas that I know.

rRGJPa14rRVltEcLV1qXtw.text: The food at Virtu is very good and the location is excellent. The menu is short - about a half dozen starters and entrees, and 3 desserts. We tried the grilled octopus starter, the squid ink linguine with octopus and the smoked duck. We followed-up with a visit that included the two octopus dishes again. All were excellent. The linguine with red sauce and garlic was really good... A+. The signature octopus starter is good... but when compared to say the octopus at Mediterranean Explorations Company in Portland... it pales in comparison, and seems to try too hard. But why quibble? It's good. The desserts and cocktails have all been in the great category - with a grappa and grape cocktail on the front side, and a mascarpone ice cream with balsamic red figs to finish. On the latest visit both the cocktails and desserts were A+ again. Things developed slowly through the evening - any slower it would have been an issue. Highly recommended.

b_uaFo9k01nWAeykrau51A.text: I made a dinner reservation but when we got there our table wasn't ready. That was weird. The food was very good and I enjoyed the presentation when our food was brought to us. The waiter took time to explain our dishes to us and made sure everything was satisfactory. The restaurant started getting busy so towards the end of our meal the service became neglected. Overall the evening was very enjoyable. I would like to go back again.

m31TZ4c-mToPiHd35xMsNw.text: Went to Virtu Honest Craft twice last week - and both times had a fabulous experience. On Wed night, sat at the bar and had some phenomenal cocktails while talking mixology with the very friendly and knowledgeable bartender. Each of the complex drinks was perfectly balanced and was made with fresh, high quality ingredients. We also had a wonderful dessert. The service was so comfortable and cordial..... so we returned for brunch Fri morning and WOW!!! The food was so creative, so well presented - and the flavors were simply amazing. We have eaten at many restaurants in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area over the years - but none can beat this place. A must go if you're a cocktail-loving foodie!!!

Sbctrs6rKCZdzhoq6I8wiQ.text: With all the hype about this place we had to try it for brunch with the full intention of returning for dinner.  Nestled into this wonderful boutique hotel we were expecting a 5 star brunch.  What we got were two dishes that were bland and aesthetically unpleasing.  Both dishes were highly recommended by our server who BTW was equally as bland.  Nothing special here.  Over rated and overpriced.

jtjqwWZDMdu-o58NEyLXcg.text: On a girls weekend to Phoenix, we stopped in for lunch. Every bit of our experience was fantastic!  The service was attentive and informative without being overwhelming. We tried several different dishes and every single one was fabulous!  From salads to burgers to crepes... try anything! You will not be disappointed.  As a side note, I am not an adventurous eater, but joined the table in trying Octopus.  The Octopus was delicious, and prepared better than anywhere you've ever experienced!

HvZo8Q2Nb4TRAo4Gzk36Kg.text: Easter Sunday morning and a very delicious brunch menu. I believe it is their regular Sunday brunch menu, so you may enjoy these tidbits all year long. We started with a gracious hello, competent and very friendly waitstaff, and a few beverages. Their cocktails are dynamite and the beer selection was very nice for a small-ish place. As recommended by our waitress, we started with the char-grilled octopus. Oh My Yum. This was tender, flavorful, and perfectly grilled. We loved the accompanying salad and dressing as well. My daughter had the lemon ricotta pancakes (delectably sweet and tasty). Her fiance had the grilled cheese sammy - great bread (Noble) that I would have again and again and again. Hubby had the pork dish with gooey egg on top - the best meal on the table! And I had the French Toast - again with Noble Bread and perfectly done. We splurged on the chocolate date cake afterwards, with a scoop of the sorbet. All in all - SO DAMN GOOD! I will be back for more.

bDJJ3vZQARmuXdHP-_4-nw.text: So sad to write a review like this for what used to be one of our favorite restaurants.. we made a reservation for my birthday for a party of 15 but when my husband called to confirm they had double booked our table.. we agreed to Change the time but when we called to double check the night before they had once again double booked our time... most people would cancel at this point but we decided to hold on to the reservation thinking the food would make it worthwhile.. unfortunately the dinner tonight was a disappointment all around. We have always had good service but our server tonight was rude and unfriendly ... whereas normally the food is amazing, tonight the food was a disappointment.  We ordered every appetizer on the menu... the octopus was overcooked And much too smoky, the rabbit gnocchi was blah, the marrow was over salted.. The salads were alright but the burrata was great.  As far as entrees the scallops were good (they always have been) but the fish was over salted and overdone.. the pork chop had good reviews from the men and was well cooked as was the steak.  Sadly it was the overall experience that ruined this restaurant for us... from the poor planning with reservations to the unfriendly service and finally mediocre food ...

ZKeFDdXWgSwaJ-qG9fxs8g.text: Been here on a special romantic date! It's A Michelin Star! Chefs and waiters are very accommodating and professional! The food is scrumdiddlyumptious!!!

mSCS6_QTjqHU7pS5Bkoycw.text: Amazing amazing amazing. The food the atmosphere incredible the best meal I've had in years chart octopus amazing my fish the burrata... I cannot wait to go back here this is a must must must

wZVduYC4c7YftR03DF8c9w.text: Best meal in AZ, hands down. Appetizers, pasta course, main courses, dessert, after-dinner drinks... everything was perfect, not a single miss. Service was beyond phenomenal (thank you, Ivan!), and the place has a wonderful romantic ambiance. The grilled octopus needs to be on every foodie's bucket list. The handmade bucatini was a revelation. Duck and scallops were cooked and presented flawlessly. Toffee cake was to die for. You get the idea. We'll be back!

8QmfJelczoNX_EVak6tk8Q.text: If you love outdoor dining their courtyard is for you.  The food was very good and the speciality drinks were really well done.  While I can appreciate the seasonal menu there was not a wide variety of dishes - I think there were about 6-7 main dishes with your standard beef, chicken, fish and pork with a slight variation in beef and one other chicken dish.   The appetizers were very good with my favorite being the burrata. Grilled octopus was good also. Highly recommend with a small group or a nice couples night out.  A little more on the expensive side so probably not a place you would frequent very often.  Overall great place - got 4 stars for variety of dishes

Photo of Virtù - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Roasted pork rib

FCMxS9R_1_y-3Lhrnq4v5A.text: Simply stated, Virtu is the absolute best in class for gastronomical fare, impeccable service and flawless execution. Having traveled Asia, Europe, North and South America and the Middle East on countless occasions - and having dined at some of the very best rated venues this world has to offer - I rank this jewel of an establishment a Michelin 3 star and an absolute must visit and repeat! It simply does not get better, pointe finale!

vcOkdmIEXUaAC_8-EalvIw.text: We really don't visit this place enough, but we absolutely should! It's outstanding and will take your taste buds on the very best kind of adventure. Starting with the Charred Octopus and the Panzanella, but the real treat is the craft of the plate, or entrees if you will. Now like most crafty restaurants, they will change their menu regularly, so I have not been since their new additions, but when we went, we had a pork Tomahawk that was unreal, and I wish I knew more about it. Otherwise, they do now feature a Bistecca Tagliata, a Niman Prime Tomahawk for two, I need to try this.

photos.caption: Photo of Virtù - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Charred Octopus, deliciously weird
Photo of Virtù - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork Tomahawk, no longer on menu :(

i7jeLmzuE1VeM3KENMxXYQ.text: It waa OK. I love the creative meal choices and hand crafted cocktail, all are great and very original.   Been there once and felt like it is more of a bucket list dinning experience rather a place I'd want to go back to again.

NjQgvmR0Zs-IP1R9ro_RvQ.text: I would give this a five star rating because the food, ambiance and our server, Jenny, are deserving of it.  However our first impression was with the hostess, Margaret, who so lacked good manners, it set the tone for the meal.  A restaurant of this quality needs to employ a grownup with customer service skills to greet and seat guests.

ZDbfO9qILC4UgIrCoQg73Q.text: I was so looking forward to the octopus dish after reading the reviews, but my dish was a big disappointment.  The chef had charred the fish to a crisp so that it was tough and the tips inedible. The grilled cheese sandwiches were black as well. Service let us down too because our poor waitress was the only staff waiting on the entire restaurant and patio for lunch.  She tried her best, but they really needed another person during the lunch hour.  And how do they get away with charging $45 for a bottle of Prosecco? Over-cooked and over-priced.

GaDLnMo00v9M3k4xPPLo_w.text: Delicious! We've been here twice already and will be coming back. We've sat on the patio both times, which even in the winter at night is fine because they have great heat lamps and blankets.  The first time was just for cocktails - and they were delicious. The second time we got wine, a small plate, and dinner. The wine list is great. We got the asparagus small plate which was to die for. The way the over easy duck egg mixed with the hollandaise sauce was amazing. We both got the squid ink pasta for dinner and it was perfection. I haven't been able to find that dish outside of Venice, Italy so we were so excited to try it. It did not disappoint. Love this cute little place!

J33d0GtA0xke8X3Fy6jjGQ.text: As good as it gets in The Valley!  Probably closer to 4.5 stars.  The space at Virtu is warm and inviting.  My service was extraordinarily friendly and help.  Charred octopus truly may be the best dish in the area at the moment. Smoke duck breast was supurb!  Very minor, but the dish probably didn't need the foie gras tart.  The duck with frites and foie could stand on their own.    I'd go back.

cVXHb3g7KvbVUN9M8ikBWg.text: Went last night, a Friday night.   Reservations are a smart thing to do because the place is busy and popular.   The food and vibe were both fantastic.   Charred Octo is a must-try.  I had the pork flat iron, which was great.   This was also a Restaurant Week menu.  I will go back.

_SOUKamJXsbbQu1MusQk1A.text: Easter Sunday was our third time here and it wasn't as memorable as it had been in the past. It was a beautiful day and it certainly was nice to sit outside in their nice garden but the service and food were just okay. I must say my mother enjoyed the ricotta pancakes and the portion was just enough for her but if you're hungry the portion might be considered small especially at the price point of $12.00 for 2 medium sized pancakes. I ordered the grilled cheese with prosciutto and fig jam which was tasty but the prosciutto must have been mashed up in it because neither could you taste it or see it; I guess I was expecting thinly sliced strips of prosciutto for $13.00. The arugula and fennel salad was nice with a light dressing. My husband had chistorra (sausage) and eggs which he said was mostly potatoes for $14.00. The coffee wasn't bad since it wasn't bitter but it was weak. Our server seemed to have an attitude but he was prompt with making sure we refills on coffee and water without having to ask. Doubt we will return with so many other places in the valley to try.

wGE93XlaKnAAF0caJbwrOw.text: This is a wonderful place.  My husband and I have come a couple of times.  We usually don't plan, so we don't mind sitting at the bar.  It is fun to see all the action there.  The first time I had the Amante Appasionato, super delicious drink, I don't remember what we had to eat because it was a while ago and most of their menu seems to change a bit.  This last time I had the scallops, they were perfectly cooked and the sauce with the bacon made for a scrumptious bite.  My husband had the charred octopus, this is one of their signature dishes and I can understand why.  This is the best octopus I've ever had.  It was not chewy at all, tender with a nice smoky taste, delicious.  I had a couple of cocktails, one was off the menu, a version of the Ice Queen but with gin instead of vodka, really great.  How could I forget to mention the dessert, oh my, this chocolate toffee cake with mascarpone ice cream was to die for.  I could have liked the plate.  The place is small inside, so if you want a table, better make reservations.  They have a nice patio, but on cold nights I think they keep it close.  I am a definite fan, I want to come sometime for brunch, the menu look

Photo of Virtù - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Delicious scallops

ryMh3ZGYpH0exC1aqUYTMg.text: A wonderful restaurant that is worth a visit. The inside is quite small, so sitting outside may be a better bet. The outside patio looked gorgeous with its romantic lighting draping over the surroundings. But it was a little hot outside so I stuck with a small table inside. I ordered a few items, even though I could have ordered the whole menu with my appetite. I started off with the octopus. Although its criminal with how little they give you, it was still delicious. The addition of chickpeas is a nice contrast in texture. The sauce is plate licking good.  The local spring salad was great but it wasn't anything that was amazing. Still, the goat cheese and prosciutto create a great french feel, with the cheese board and salad colliding into one The duck entree was worth the visit. The duck being moist and tender was only the tip of this voyage of a meal. The flavors were so orgasmic! The dancing juxtaposition of sweet and savory pair so well like two veteran tango dancers. The fresh ingredients only elevate the meal even further. Every bite was wonderful, and I purposely slowed down to enjoy every morsel. Im quite excited for what this place has to offer. I hope this place stays for quite some time.

Ne8nC6skVSQhepqSOolzCA.text: Just had dinner at Virtu with my wife for our date night. Was fantastic and I highly recommend getting reservation on the patio has a great vibe.  It's like an Italy patio with nice lighting and brick floors. Had the pork chop and it was awesome. Great date night place in old town Scottsdale

r31BapoXLLXrFmniOB_NGA.text: Excellent, fresh, unique, classy.  Octopus, asparagus, and trout appetizers - 10/10 Squid ink pasta, Porcetta, and tuna entrees - 10/10 Cocktails - 10/10  Lifesavers instead of regular breath mints sealed the deal for me

4eSYmmlRGsI5lKNRvvyjZA.text: Came early on a Wednesday evening. A lot of the seating is outside in a pleasant little courtyard with lots of flora and birds. The weather was pleasant, and I'm glad I could enjoy it -- the indoor area looks like it may have been a little limited/cramped.   Recommending most of the menu items might not make sense, as my understanding is that the menu changes frequently based on quality and availability. But if you get the chance to order the polpo, take it. The octopus is exceptionally tender and it's served with a sauce that is creamy and gently spicy -- the end result is like eating a shrimp cocktail mixed with a deviled egg. It was innovative, revelatory, and fun.   Staff is professional and knowledgeable. I wasn't shy about asking questions about dishes or wines, and I received quality guidance delivered graciously.   The dessert was a cioccolato, which is perhaps misleading. The cake tasted of toffee, and the ice cream of salted caramel. It was like eating a Rolo candy, but with the experience of having it as a chic little cake. I drank an Americano with it, which was well made and comparable to a higher-end coffee shop.  They seem to take their drink menu seriously, with an abundance of original concoctions written by an actual mixologist.   Overall a very pleasant experience -- they spend attention on everything that matters, and little on the things that don't.

op1vlNoWFEqZeFbmw08rwg.text: A great hidden gem with a spectacular, ever changing menu.  Food rich in depth and variety, we absolutely loved it when we spent our anniversary in Scottsdale.  Intimate setting with excellence of service.  The bartender Fernando was a great guide into new pairings and experiences.  Highly recommend for a intimate night out. Cheers!

15SuOGi5CaclxGtbbnFE9Q.text: Seriously good.  In fact closer to amazingly good.   The octopus. OMG. It's worth going there just to sit in the bar and have wine or a cocktail and a few rounds or their octopus.  I've had octopus in word class restaurants all over the world, but nothing comes close to this.  And if you think you don't like octopus. Your thinker needs to get a reprogram.   As for the rest of the meal.  That was world class too.  Smoked duck.  Order it.  Scallops. Amazing.    Cocktail.  Killer.

GVkAJqeAbnHPv-2hPbvUWg.text: All I am reviewing is the STICKY TOFFEE PUDDING. UGH! Let me tell you it was the best. Probably the best dessert I've ever had, to tell you the truth.   If you go there (it is pricey) save some room for the dessert!!

vNI2jKc8o-StNYxkX5SV7Q.text: All by my lonesome and 1st time in Phoenix in over 30 years so I googled places to eat and asked where I should go. It's pointed me to Virtu. I should point out that there was no Yelp, Google or smartphones last time I was in town... Hell the www was in its infancy back then and nobody knew what to do with it yet come to think of it.   I started with the grilled octopus which was absolutely incredible, almost like eating butter (well the consistency, not like eating real butter as that would be gross)  Actually I started with a martini which was nice but I prefer the triangle shaped classes rather than the round rimmed glasses. I don't know why that always ruins a martini when it's served like that.  For my main I had the Manzo, Vermouth braised short rib with a glass of Malbec. It was fantastically prepared just the right portion size. Really well prepared and plated.   Was served by three waitstaff including an attentive  hostess who checked in a couple of times to see how things were. Not too much not too little.  All and all the great meal great service and I go back there if I had the opportunity again, but I'd bring my own Martini glass.

RoIxOvFupnbsiIjM3HsUFA.text: Virtu was so excellent. The service from Matthew was amazing and really shaped our dinner experience at virtu.   Matthew went above and beyond to explain the menu and offer recommendations to us and really shared his appreciation of food with us.   It was our first time dining here and everything we ordered with the help of Matthew was amazing. The octopus, scallops, chicken, and salted Carmel toffee cake were out of this world.   The octopus wasn't chewy at all and are definitely a must.   The scallops practically melted in your mouth with how soft they were and the flavor palette was so satisfying.   The chicken had the best flavor and the toasted crispy kale on top was so delicious.   It was my fiance's birthday and we got a dessert on the House. The salted caramel gelato on top of the toffee chocolate cake was tasty and not too sweet. The sweetness level was perfectly balanced just like every other part of the meal.  I definitely recommend virtu for date nights or special occasions. You won't regret it

WOO_FXcbuBrPlirb0-lYig.text: So delicious. Some of the best food and service in az. Octopus and pasta are absolute must orders.

IPF5WbDcByKONmOY5XMSMw.text: My return visit to Virtu was everything I'd remembered and then some - octopus is as perfect as ever, the scallops with miso pork belly were expertly prepared and the burrata I had for dessert was actually off the appetizer menu...I was just still thinking about it as I finished my entree. Comes topped with amaretto crumbles, which makes for an unexpected, slightly sweet crunch...I might have slow clapped had it not been such an intimate setting. Virtu has been around for a few years but stands the test of time!

i7osRkdgwUSmtKNit3KZGQ.text: We celebrated our anniversary at Virtu last night and it was nothing short of amazing!  We sat by the outdoor fountain at a delightful table that was set off and quiet.  Perfect for our celebration.  We were given a complimentary Prosecco and card from the kitchen in honor of our anniversary.  A very nice touch.    The staff is better than 5 stars and that is essential for a top notch review.  We started at the bar for a cocktail and the bartender was extremely informative and well versed in the specific area we were inquiring about.  He made us two (different) of some of the best martini's I've ever had.  His knowledge led us to try something outside of our box and we loved it!  Our server, Ivan was even better, if that is possible!  He knew every detail about the menu and was happy to steer us in a direction we wanted to go.  He was helpful throughout our evening at every turn and never imposing or pushy.  We loved our meal.  We shared 3 plates starting with an appetizer, which was their pulpo.  I have had pulpo, good and bad at many places and this ranked right on top with the best. Tender and succulent on a nicely complimentary sauce with just enough bite to tickle your senses. Our next dish was their pappardelle with mushrooms and white truffles (an add on).  This was yummy, but not my fav of the night and it was by far the most expensive (due to the truffle addition)  I felt it was served a bit dry for my liking.  Our next course was their scallops and they were fantastic!  Not over stuffing ourselves, left room for dessert and we had their pistachio gelato - unlike any variety you've had with True pistachio flavor and very creamy.  However, what took top billing for me, was their butterscotch budino.  Absolutely out of this world!  We thoroughly enjoyed their custom Italian coffee, robust and delightful, served cold.  A perfect ending to a perfect evening!

gQrF5wKymyA6TQzercxhVA.text: Creative cocktails, creative menu, great eats, great staff, fun environment.

jO0FjQOCjw6OtWMygkJuiw.text: Virtu is probably one of the best foodie spots in Arizona that I have tried thus far. A little on the pricier side, but the quality food and service is totally worth the cost for this low-key upscale place. I came here for dinner on a Thursday night with a friend and we shared an appetizer, meal, dessert, and each had two cocktails. Everything was spectacular added with a side of exceptional customer service that can't be beat in this area of Scottsdale.  Service: Our waitress was incredible. She read out the whole menu in detail and gave us the specials, too. My friend who came with me is vegetarian so we asked her for vegetarian options, and right away she listed off the vegetarian substitutions for many of the favorites we were eyeing on the menu. They space out the drinks and food so you have enough time to digest and enjoy your evening. The staff does not rush you at all. I felt so welcomed and comfortable here.  Ambiance: So intimate and romantic! Small candles lit up a darkened room at night. If you want to take pictures of food, definitely sit outside because the lighting is better in the patio. I loved the intimate seating   Food:  All items are small plates, perfect to share a few with someone, which is exactly what we did. The menu changes up to accommodate to seasonal foods that are sourced locally and also caters to the unique creativity of recipes that are constantly being updated.  *Dates* A plate of dates served over a squash sauce. I recognized the taste of ghee (clarified butter) that was in the sauce (a taste from my childhood- almost as good as my mom's homemade ghee), and it really added to the richness of the flavors surrounding the dates. The dates were so soft, warm, and melts in your mouth.   *Gnocchi*  the menu describes the gnocchi as "potato pillows" and that's exactly what they were..tiny pillows of potato, super soft, melt-in-your mouth little bites of heaven. This special gnocchi had a sweet taste from the marsala butter sauce it was soaked in, had a crispy topping that was the perfect touch. It was rich, so it was the best bowl for sharing. So, so delicious I want more NOW.  *Chocolate Lava Cake with Gelato* OH. MY. Goodness. This dessert was the perfect ending to our night. The chocolate cake was so decadent and almost brownie-ish tasting, filled with a fudge-like filling. It was served with a salted caramel gelato on top. The salted caramel gelato was my favorite tasting gelato at this place out of the three that we tried that nightl.  *Gelato* my friend and I wanted to try another gelato on the side of our chocolate cake + gelato dessert...(yes, more gelato!!) and we were debating between pistachio and hazelnut. Our waitress acknowledged our perplexity over this issue and kindly offered to give us both- 1/2 pistachio and 1/2 hazelnut. It was a little hard to differentiate the two after we were served the gelato, and I'm sure that's because they don't add any crazy food colorings, which is amazing! So both were kind of a tan color with finely chopped nuts mixed in. Both were delicious, creamy, and not too sweet.  Drinks: specially handcrafted cocktails-- *Virtu Starter Kit* this was such a refreshing drink. I wanted something light and citrusy, but still strong and one that hit the spot. I highly recommend this drink if you're looking for something not too sweet, light, and refreshing. Ingredients: Cocchi Vermouth di Torino, Gin, Grapefruit Bitters, Bitter Lemon Soda, Lemon Essence. I ordered two of these.  I can tell the cooks, owners, entire staff put their hearts and souls into each and every item on the menu including the drinks. I will most certainly go back to try more items from Virtu. The food and service exceeded my expectations. No wonder they were nominated for the James Beard Foundation Award AND according to Esquire, one of the best new restaurants in America when they first opened!

TmR_0YRpZlaVArpMg_5sQQ.text: The reviews were not wrong!  Virtu has a great ambiance with a wonderful patio setup. We arrived as they opened and so glad we did.  Our waiter Jeremy took great care of us and pointed out the favorite and few regular items on the menu.    The Chef prepared the BEST octopus we have ever eaten!  Wow!  Delicious!  The menu changes based on the Chef's choice and based on our meal that we completely enjoyed, we will trust the Chef and staff for future recommendations!    Highly recommended trying Virtu if you are in Old Town Scottsdale.

The menu is quite short, but I appreciate a few well done dishes than a bunch of mediocre ones. The pasta was exceptional as were the appetizers, Polpo, Aspargi, Mozzarella di Bufala. Fast service. Great food. Nice, casual ambience. Ample parking nearby.

xxTZGHdEuW91aJUVisKF1w.text: This is a great tucked away little spot that you really wouldn't notice unless you look for you. It works though. It's super quaint, has a great patio and is sort of attached to a little B n B. Who knew?  We went there for restaurant week and it was my first time.  Fantastic! I was especially happy to have lamb skewers as a appetizer option. Lamb is the best food ever.  The lamb was cooked to perfection and the hummus like sauce was a perfect compliment. I also got the veal chop which was also cooked perfectly.  Great crust on the outside and tender on the inside. And huge. For desert we got the chocolate cake option and it was rich and full of chocolate flavor.  What set this restaurant over the top were the employees.  I was early for our reservation and the bartender was super friendly.  a huge shout out to Ivan, our waiter. Give that guy a raise!  He explained all kinds of info about the restaurant, brunch, the history, the chef.... He also gave tips about what to order during non restaurant weeks.  We will definitely be back.

1Jsgogo3htkNdnKhLfcYTw.text: I kept hearing about their octopus dish so this restaurant was on my list. We went on a Sunday afternoon. We were lucky it wasn't busy because it's a small place with a big beautiful patio. We ordered a drinks, crespella and polpo. The crepe needed more sauce because it tasted dried. The octopus was well cooked but the overall dish was ok. It's too bad the food wasn't a wowzer.

p-LUkQfnqLMKiwEhriANdA.text: I love this place. The food and service is CONSISTENTLY Exceptional! I have eaten here well over a dozen times. I never have to worry about what I will be getting or the service quality because it is always well above average. I love coming here for special occasions like birthdays or when family is in town because I know I won't ever be disappointed. I also know my family members won't be disappointed. Everything on the menu is delicious. Oh and I forgot to mention to save room for dessert! You won't want to share the dessert so just get your own.

yhsj2dSHPFxT0iOICr0n9w.text: We opted to enjoy an appetizer, pasta and entree, as well as cocktails and a glass of wine. The ambiance was lovely, and had it not been one of the "colder" Arizona nights we would have definitely sat on the patio. Our server Taylor was clearly versed in the menu, and made excellent recommendations.  The menu is constantly rotating, and each dish that we tried was delicious. Will definitely add to our rotation of date night restaurants!

vrT_3T_SukOoHeP11ab-Kw.text: My new favorite restaurant!  I was invited to a birthday party at Virtu last evening and I can't remember a more delightful dining experience. We were seated in the courtyard, which is so perfect this time of year.   I began with my favorite sparkling wine, Moscato di Asti, which always puts me in a celebratory mood. For starters our table ordered the lamb skewers and the burrata salad. You won't want to share your lamb, so order your own, but the burrata is so rich, it can indeed serve two.  My dinner entree was a delicious pasta dish ... but the piece de resistance was a grilled veal chop with THE MOST DELICIOUS sauteed sweet onions I've ever tasted in my entire life.  This dish was OUTSTANDING, in fact, I just made reservations for next week to bring my entire family. We have a well behaved dog, and so this allows all 8 of us (plus Fido) to enjoy a lovely evening under the stars.  I definitely plan on ordering that veal chop again!!!  Dessert: it is not an afterthought. In fact, I must commend Virtu for their gelato selections, there were quite a lot to choose from. I ordered 3 flavors: salted caramel, dark chocolate and vanilla chocolate chip. If you don't order the gelato you'll miss out. It's THAT great! I also had their sticky chocolate cake. It's very sweet, so plan on sharing it with the table. You'll only need a bite of the cake as you'll be devouring your gelato ...  What more can I say? Visit Virtu, you will love it!

_ZYxazvygoaAKKlExRSh0Q.text: Just go!  Found this at random looking for restaurants to try in Scottsdale, read reviews and made a reservation.  Lovely setting and easy to overlook with the discreet street entrance. My only dislike of the whole dining experience is that we were seated right inside the entrance and the tables are very close together.  Had to try the octopus and now I can't stop thinking about it. The lemon pasta was very good as well with a perfect serving size (I shared with my friend).  We both had the pork chop and it was wonderful.  Although i was convinced I couldn't eat another bite, she talked me into the decadent chocolate dessert.  Our wait staff was Matteo (sp) and he was wonderful.

VplVOVAoZrACRcWqR7alZA.text: This hidden gem is my favorite breakfast spot in Old Town. I definitely recommend for the outdoor seating. Indoor is nice but they have such a beautiful green area outside. I would dress up a little more for this place its nicer with white tablecloth. A word of warning the coffee is ADDICTING. I have like 4 cups when I go and am bouncing off the walls afterward. The menu is always changing but everything I have ever tried has been delicious. This past time I have a crepe filled with Bri and Ham. It was a very large which was great because I enjoyed every bite. Every single dish is always so well thought out and I always have trouble choosing because it alls pounds good. I always have excellent service and always look forward to my next visit. I would like to try it for dinner I just haven't had the opportunity yet. Try this place. I am telling you, you will not be disappointed.

4rJqypKDyQLQIcWgPdSQaw.text: One of, if not the best restaurants in the valley! Chef Gio kills it. Great seasonality to the menu. The octopus is fantastic. Pastas are homemade. One of the best Amari selections in the State! Ambience is perfect for a date! Sit on the patio and be prepared to be blown away. Trust me.

G1QNuFHOWgjOi_lN9sJnRQ.text: Omg what a great find, food amazing w outstanding service our server Ivan was the best. We highly recommend this gem!

v4_aPzJqjFz80svhlv0y6Q.text: Virtu is perfection.  It's an intimate neighborhood restaurant just a couple blocks from Old Town. The food is inventive, Mediterranean-inspired, and delicious.  We had the trio of small plates with tuna tartare, a sausage/potatoes dish, and croquettes. Then we shared a bucatini pasta which was fabulous. But the highlight was the grilled octopus. I am still dreaming of that dish!   I am so glad we did not skip dessert. We had a butterscotch pudding that was divine.   The wine list is very creative with several regional French, Italian, and Spanish options.    Service was also exceptional.  This restaurant ranks for me with some of my favorite meals at top fine dining establishments around the world. Kudos!

_iEQgdOEShDpUOfx4VqrwA.text: Absolutely beautiful place and food, but snobby atmosphere that we are not used to dealing with, despite coming from a large east coast city with more award winning restaurants than you can count. We ordered all the most recommended dishes, including octopus, asparagus, pigs ears, and short ribs, and each was delicious and beautifully presented. However, the restaurant was generally uninterested in accommodating the palates of our two small kids, though the one option we had (spaghetti with red sauce) turned out to be a hit. In fact, the tenor with which we were received at the restaurant only turned positive once we placed our order for a bottle of wine, which made us wonder if they assumed we were not likely to order a substantial meal. We were also told that there were no reservations other than 5:00, and then found ourselves dining alone for about an hour before others arrived-which again left us wondering if we were only offered an early option because we were with kids. Not sure, and again, it worked out ok for us, but this is not necessarily the easiest place to bring children. Coming from a city where fine dining does not mean excluding children, we thought our experience here was worth noting.

btjwqLUylThA4GPpNrptvA.text: My husband and I came with some friends for brunch, and had an ok experience. Everyone said their food was average. Drinks were good, we especially liked the passion fizz

oevMQ_nI8oddCVT1YtfhTA.text: This place was quiet and near empty when we came in for Sunday brunch which would lead me to believe that it was not good but what a hidden gem! This was probably one of the best brunch me and my 4 girlfriends have had! I got the crepe which was full of ham and cheese it was so tasty I basically licked my plate.  There were so many tasty options on the menu so it was difficult to decide but classic crepe was the right choice!!

photos.caption: Photo of Virtù - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Classic crepe! Delicious!!

VJ8AsvZumITJrN7MLGjS8g.text: The impossible is accomplished here.  The brunch menu pork ragu with egg is a must!  Also chistorria with egg.  It sounds like too much embryonic poultry, but it works.  Hoke led us thru the culinary delight with a wry smile.  Local foodies beware, this would take up an entire culinary day of my week, if I lived here.  If there is no Michelin star Gio Osso, then it's fixed.

-_dAFXiiSSgAT0IFlbxO5Q.text: Amazing! Octupus is the bomb and seating outside is limited so call ahead for a reservation or grab a seat at the bar. Full menu and wonderful view of kitchen.

_6JVKFOVuPvN2HIPEeG4sw.text: Super knowledgeable wait staff  (both food and cocktails/wine), their desserts really shine!!! Came back a day later to have dessert after being disappointed at another "great" restaurant :) The toffee one is crack :)

B10zi78uVsGClQwAK2Jadg.text: This place is the real deal!  Hidden gem! This restaurants' taste is world class.  I enjoy 99% of the staff, only have had one less than stellar server. He honestly kind of dampers the whole experience with his attitude.  He works the bar in the morning sometimes short guy.  Not really sure why he works there.   Anyway  I highly recommend you try the crepe, French toast, or pancakes for brunch and anything on the dinner menu! ( burrata, pumpkin gnocchi, pork chop). Please give this restaurant your business. They deserve it.  One of the highest quality restaurants in old town.

uAvFZpXs0IMbMN2KfMkkpQ.text: Tried them out during  restaurant week.  Food was decent, but the business practice was shady beyond anything I've experienced in past.  One drink (tequila + soda) = $27.50.   What makes this crazy is the actual drink was $22 and the ice in the drink was $5.50.  Manager tells me "you get more with the ice".  I guess shame on me for not asking if ice in the drink would make it more expensive.  Never again.

HWXZJhtjMeYjpxUfclW0VQ.text: This place is such a wonderful hidden gem. It is a favorite of mine and my mom's. They have amazing cocktails, my favorite is the Ice Queen. And the most delicious appetizer of asparagus with duck egg and candied bacon.  Soooo good. Their menu changes with the seasons but these two favorites are usually there. A romantic places for special occasions as well and beautiful tranquil outdoor dining. Book early to get in.

-wbw3Ad2UIQ8y4GrmSdhAg.text: Wow!  Chef Osso has made a collection of different cuisines that make my pallet yearn for more. From the start with a Moscow Mule to the end with actions shot espresso, the service was perfect. From the starter plate of Charred Octopus being do amazingly tender and flavorful to the smoked, yet medium-rare duck breast that I completely enjoyed. Both paired well with a bottle of Zinfandel from their wine list. A must try restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Virtù - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Super tender charred octopus will open your pallet for the evening.

WBaH9qaILOR7gEgj8aeWWA.text: Great food but the scallops are very very small like four peaces small the stake is great the same goes for the octopus

EsvvA0oDWLCtEe4mv6W3AQ.text: We had or birthday dinner there and they were so generous giving us free dessert and the atmosphere is to die for! A must try place!  the duck asparagus and sticky chocolate cake are amazing!

ZFa8Kly61reJNlZPeH1eLA.text: The food was great with nice ambience. However, I did not like the fact that the kitchen was right next to the dining area. This is a small restaurant and the kitchen ventilation is not very good. It gets stocky easily when sitting inside. It was supposed to be a romantic restaurant but my shirt smelled like I just had some grill BBQ after my dinner.

vewSI2_W-frrD-1TxdPyZQ.text: This was my first meal in Scottsdale and I was blown away by everything I tasted. I really had no idea that the food overall in this town was so good, and Virtu was hands down the best. In fact, if it were my call they'd have at least one Michelin star. Seriously, one of the best meals I've had in a while.   The True standouts from everything I tasted were ( and in no particular order) -  The Charred Octopus - the flavors were right on and it was texturally satisfying as it was cooked to perfection. Probably the best octopus I've ever eaten. It's no coincidence that this is one of their most popular items on the menu.   The Smoked Duck Breast - really good flavor here and again, cooked to perfection. The smokiness is by no means overwhelming, just the right subtlety to know its there yet taste the duck and the plum (which also was subtle and not at all sweet)  The Chicken and Wild Mushroom Cannelloni - well now, maybe I should have put this one on top and listed in order of preference because thinking more about it, this just might be my favorite of all!!! This dish was exceptional! So flavorful. Quintessential happy, comfort food yet was still quite light. The pasta was very delicate and more crepe-like. The earthy yet pleasingly flavorful mushroom jus was spectacular. I'll dream fondly of this dish.   They have a very nice wine list and creative cocktails. Their signature G&T is the ideal desert libation. Service was just fine too, I was surprised to read negative reviews in this regard.   I'm not huge on dessert but their sticky toffee cake was fantastic and if I could choose a dessert menu this would be on it.   If I'm ever back in Scottsdale I will most definitely return to this restaurant. In fact, that Bespoke Inn that it's located in looks like a great place to stay. I definitely have to look into that, though this time not in the heat of the summer.

5eM6D8fFnPOnvrVZdQFAjQ.text: Very good service.  Tea was excellent.  We had three different entrees all of which were really good. I'd say it's worth the trip

6SXxEBEeRL0v3v6oDkpx4g.text: My girlfriend and I ate dinner last evening at Virtu, Scottsdale, Arizona.  From the very moment we walked in, we knew this was going to be a wonderful experience.  The hostess was incredibly accommodating and so polite.  The ambiance was very cozy and quaint and very European.  The entire staff was incredibly attentive and on point all evening.  OK, the food.  mind blowing.  The Polpo is a must try for your starter course.  May very well be one of our top 5 dining experiences ever.  Keep up the incredible work Virtu.  We will most certainly return soon.  Chad M. Rothe

7riQ5duhRamKErO-ROl6_Q.text: Man, we really wanted to like this spot!  Went last night for V-day, had prix fixe menu which always worries me but the reviews for this place are so good we had to try it.  Well, the atmosphere is great, nice and cozy...but they rushed us to order all the courses which started things off on a bad foot.  When celebrating an occasion, or paying good money for a meal, I'd prefer to take a little time to enjoy.  Our server actually said she wasn't allowed to put our first course in before we'd decided and ordered all of our courses.  We expressed concern but went along with the program.  Both of our first courses then came out cold, which seemed to indicate that they had the items just waiting to go out, which is the concern with prix fixe in the first place.  We decided to cut our losses at this point and told them we were leaving...their response, "we're not for everybody."  Ok...guess you aren't, thanks!

C978aaZ0Yn24RyFek_Z_pg.text: Came for a date night with another couple, a first time for all of us and the service from start to finish was amazing! We made a 6:30pm reservation.  This is a great place for a special occasion celebration.    The menu changes frequently (monthly I believe)  for fresh ingredients and available seasonal items--and everything looked amazing on the menu!   Our server Ivan was able to navigate us through the menu and accommodate my gluten allergy.  Everything was gluten free with the exception of the homemade pasta and maybe 1 other item!   We started with a bottle of Cabernet from Napa Valley, and decided to indulge in the 1 constant menu item, THE BISTECCA TAGLIATA 40oz niman tomahawk ribeye, rucola, chimichurri $130.00 price tag but for a special occasion it was worth every bite and it took about 45minutes to prepare, we were willing to wait.  The Tomahawk prepared medium rare had a huge argulua salad and chimichurri was fresh and perfect.  The meat was tender and sliced for easy sharing.   CAPPESANTE |seared scallops, roasted cauliflower, lemon tahini, pine nuts, urfa biber, mint. The scallops, were huge and tender and delicious, the accompanied sauce was creamy and perfect.  ANATRA | smoked duck, radicchio insalata, pear brown butter, smoked onion & taleggio phyllo. The duck, cooked medium was adapted to be gluten free, they adjusted the salad for me and added cherries and hibiscus.  Again cooked to perfection the skin was crispy and the duck was tender, just wished there was a little more.   We shared these items between the 4 of us, along with dessert. The Sticky Toffee Pudding (not gluten free) was devoured and the Butterscotch pudding (gluten free) was rich and the perfect ending to our dinner. We left satisfied, very happy but not overly full.   10/10 recommend!  The space is small, they have a bar with maybe 8 seats and behind the bar you can peak into the small the kitchen. The have a small dining area, but comfortable. The vibe is upscale, but intimate and cozy with small candles on the tables.   Looking forward to another opportunity to enjoy.   They do offer brunch on the weekends but check their website as the days and times change seasonally.    Next time we will try the Octopus-- POLPO | lemon marinated ceci, calabrese chile butter, rucola and fennel insalata, balsamico and  ASPARAGI | two wash ranch duck egg, feta, bacon candy, foie gras hollandaise, truffle drizzle and And the MAIALE | pork rib chop, rosemary brown butter basted, crispy sunchokes, caramelized onion.    Thank you Ivan for the food suggestions, modifications and excellent evening.

bxRDoo4nzUbQM5efDWOQqA.text: This restaurant is delicious to say the least! It's a foodies dream come True.   I came here for lunch with a client. For my entree I had a shortrib over polenta. It was a dream! We also split the French toast for our dessert.  Sit outside on a nice day, they have a patio that is peaceful and has great ambience.  The restaurant itself is in a boutique hotel, look for the arch to go inside!  A True old town Scottsdale gem!

hNqGTYUfGagb3fF5_1uoTw.text: Came for brunch.  Crespella. Purgatorio. French Toast.  The food was pretty delicious. Outdoor seating was great.

6IE_EyYPTUXAnzZjCrfM7A.text: This place is amazing.while not traditionally Italian , it has a Mediterranean flair. Reminds me of the back streets of Rome. Start with the grilled octopus. The special Tonight was Bone in collared sword fish , shashito peppers (charred) olive tapenade and lemon aioli, arugula with shaved fennel, grapefruit and lemon vinaigrette ended with brioche toffee cake with salted caramel and gelato. Yummy.

Photo of Virtù - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

n6L8Pm1SbJtnoZoaVWamwQ.text: It was our first time dining here, and it's our new favorite restaurant. It seemed like a restaurant in Europe with the smaller space making it seem quaint and intimate. It's got a smaller menu than many places with unique dishes, and what is on the menu is superbly executed.  We were 2 people and ordered one appetizer (the octopus), three entrees (which the server "coursed out" for us to seem like a second course before the entrees) and a desert. We also had two cocktails, a bottle of wine and port. The octopus was wonderful, not dry, and had more flavor than any octopus I have ever had. Th man next to us just returned from Greece and said it was better than any he'd had there.  The service was fantastic. Servers were very knowledgeable about the items. The duck was the best duck I have ever tasted, no gaminess and none of the oiliness you often get. I cannot commit to order an entree of duck due to past history, so I'm glad my friend did, because it was amazing. The pasta with meatballs was out of this world and the savory flavors made me wish I had a piece of bread to get every last bit of flavor from the dish.  The scallops, oh the scallops, they were uniquely seasoned and perfectly cooked with caramelization and yet perfect texture. Clearly they have wizards working in the kitchen. I would order the scallops again, the duck, the octopus, and the pasta. And the ciocolatino cake is to die for.  I recommend going at least 15 min before your reservation and having a craft cocktail. Fernando makes some mean drinks. I'm turning violet, Violet was fantastic and the whiskey sour was the best I've tasted in the valley. I only have photos of drinks as I was too busy savoring every bite to get photos.

h3HhlATCFgftA18WHyb34Q.text: My daughter selected this restaurant to celebrate her 23rd birthday, a group of six.  Walking in, you can tell that it has an upscale feel.  We got an outdoor seating which as very well designed with lights and greenery used to separate tables for privacy.  First course:   -Grilled octopus, very well made -Burata, didn't want to waste the delicious appetizer so we asked for more bread twice.  2nd Course: -Pappardelle pasta with duck egg on top.  Wow! A must have.  Main course- 2 had pork chops  3 had orata fish 1 had scallops   Everything was good except 1)  the pork chops were luke warm.  I prefer my food hot. 2). Only got 3 scallops which was more expensive than the fish.  Why not 5? 3).  Got charged $4.00 for extra bread.  Classy place with the price that goes with it...can't give extra bread without a charge.  Really?    Hostess just ok.  Our waiter was excellent.  Honestly, I'm not sure if I would go back because there's so many restaurants to try in Phoenix metro areas.  I do invite you to try it for yourself.  Main course:

9za7AINRT_QHDe-ad-59Vg.text: Delicious AF. There no other way to describe the food. I mean it's everything and more that you would expect from a James Beard Nominated eatery.  There are a few items that are standard on the menu- the octopus and asparagus and beef. There's a reason. Try them. You won't go wrong. The Polpo was tender and delicious and quite frankly reminded me of lobster as per our server. Probably close to my top octopus dish to rival the octopus at the Purple Pig in Chicago which is saying a lot. The Burrata was perfectly paired with frisee. Spaghettini. Why would you order spaghetti at a high end restaurant you ask? Bec it's not your kids spaghetti, but kids would love this too. The scallops. Sweet baby Jesus the scallops. If you like scallops at all get these. There are  only 3 but what an amazing 3 they are.  We (2) ordered 2 starters, a pasta and 2 entrees and it was more food than we could finish but so worth it. Don't make the same mistake we did and leave room for dessert so you don't suffer from food envy when you see other diners enjoying the menu of sweet treats.

7vs5ceDnN9trpF4umP9ljg.text: This was my second time to this wonderful establishment and it again didn't disappoint. Yes, it have four dollar signs, so if you're used to dinner for two for $50-60, this will feel rather expensive for you. BUT, it's WORTH every dollar.  We came for restaurant week, but you didn't have to follow the menu and could order a la carte if you wanted. I stuck to the restaurant week menu and had some of the most divine food. DEVINE!! The atmosphere is soft and romantic (patio) indoors is nice as well. The wait staff were all incredibly friendly. But. The. Food. Y'all. THE FOOD!  We started with the ice queen and the you're turning violet, violet cocktails (do yourself a favor and read through the entire cocktail menu for some of the punniest sayings). Which were delightful. Then we started with the mozerella and the panelle, followed by the asparagi, then to our main dishes of the vitello and the chitarra.  ALL OF WHICH WAS AMAZING! Then, dessert of pudding and the chocolate cake. Which are pale descriptions to the amazingness that was these desserts. If you have the chance to go here, go.  Want to feel fancy, go. Want to have a food experience, go. Want to wow your date with the best food, go. Go. Go. And go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Virtù - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pudding dessert
Photo of Virtù - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chitarra - delicious!!!
Photo of Virtù - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cake dessert

UJl6Q6wdbBMi132MARr_zg.text: Came back here again for an early Valentine's Day dinner and it was just as good as the first time! It gets crowded on weekends without a reservation so be sure to make one!   We sat at the bar because we didn't make a reservation and we grabbed the last two seats in the house. Even though it was a little squeezy, sitting at the bar was quite interesting because you get to see the rush making the drinks and the bartender/waiters will engage in conversation with you so overall even just waiting for the food was a good experience.   This time we ordered:   Polpo (5/5): we got this the first time and even though they don't give a lot, the octopus is perfectly tasty and chewy! It's consistent which is good. Def recommend this to anyone trying virtu   Cappesante *Scallops*(5/5): i don't remember what exactly it was called cause they change their menu often but it had scallops and pork belly with some sort of onion vegetable under. Scallops were cooked perfectly (not the rubbery kind) and the dish was full of flavor!   Anatra *duck (3.5/5): again depending on what time you come what they pair the duck with will be differentiate. This time it was a smoked duck with a chocolate sauce and mandarin oranges. Although I appreciated their efforts in pairing the duck and chocolate, it just didn't go together. When I came two years ago their duck was perfect so I think it just depends what they decide to create for the menu depending on what time you come. Duck was cooked well but the sauce was just weird with it haha.   Cciocolato *Sticky toffee pudding (5/5): had this the first time I was here and it was so good had to order it again and it was consistently perfect! It is paired with a salted caramel gelato. The cake is perfectly moist and not over sweet or over salty and everything comes together perfectly!   For drinks, I don't remember the exact name but one had lavender (I think the name has violet in it) and it was unique amazing! I would rate it 5/5. And the other drink was a berry drink with egg white on top. I would give that one a 3.5/5. Pictures are attached.   Overall I still love this place and think it is the perfect place if you want to go to fine dining! Though I didn't enjoy all the dishes the service was still great and I had an overall great experience. Maybe just not all the time since it's on the pricy side but it's good for special occasions!

Kn_es5e1xFCrxEx1x19mNA.text: Virtu is great! We came here for dinner (over the summer) while celebrating our anniversary and we had a wonderful dinner/dining experience.    We sat outside at a cozy little table.  Shared some great drinks and a bottle of wine.  We ordered a delicious octopus appetizer and split their Tomahawk ribeye with chimichurri...OMG it was soon good!  Our server was great!  We will be back soon:)

dojkz53MXah_jUk9i7Ix0g.text: Had a family emergency and had to cancel reservation more than 30 minutes prior to the reservation for 6 people and they change $25 a person to cancel yet they don't tell you this prior to booking. This is honestly the dumbest thing I've ever heard. Hey  I

OHZuAR06yECoppEJO8q3hw.text: Wow. This was a special birthday dinner for me and it will be hard to find another place to celebrate in the future. We went early because we were going to a concert and they whisked us right in (with a reservation). The weather was perfect (end of March) and we sat outdoors on the patio. Even though it is a relatively small area, the set up of the patio gives it a very intimate yet private feel. It appears to be connected to a small boutique hote.  From the moment we sat down, it was an exceptional experience. Our server was incredibly knowledgable and had a lot of great ideas about our sit down cocktails. He also talked us through the menu from start to finish. It's a great idea to share dishes as there is so much to experience. Our drinks were delicious. The food was exquisite and I will continuously recommend this spot to others.   I really can't say enough - this is a go-to dinner spot.

Rdz4FopQgEPoXVLuTdMnbA.text: What a beautiful place.  Food: 5 Service: 5 Ambiance: 5 Cocktails: 5  This is one of the best restaurants in PHX. Located under a boutique hotel, the location and the decor are very nice.  We've tried everything on their menu and it never disappoints. A must go when we have family or friends in town, they can't leave without experiencing Virtu.  Service is very professional and quick. Hok served us many times and is great.  The changing menu is so attractive and tempting, it will keep you going back. I'm not going to highlight the few dishes we like here because literally, everything on the menu we've had was fantastic, including their brunch menu.  They have some classic as well as crafted cocktails and they are fantastic too. The fortified truth and ice queen are our favorites.  Without question a leading top 5 restaurant for us in PHX.

jdum3IVrQXNP9Fz2QSRDgA.text: Food was amazing. My mom is a very harsh critic when it comes to restaurants & doesn't find a lot that she likes here in AZ. She absolutely loved this one (minus their pasta, but the rest of us liked it). Service was great ass well. I loved the 2 cocktails I got. The place is very small with a Spanish vibe.

They take there time to Serve you the dishes and space out your  Courses. Everything we tried was fun and interesting. Lots of fun takes on original dishes. The waiter was amazing and so attentive. The wine was awesome, and the cocktails were very creative. Food was extremely gourmet and original tasting. Overall I would definitely go back and highly recommend this place.

NYV3I62dSoNdkVVd5KvbTw.text: I am from Orange County, California & came to Scottsdale for a weekend trip. I stumbled upon this GEM  of a restaurant on a walk to old town in search of Brunch. Wow, did I get lucky! Outside court yard is beautiful & tranquil. I felt like I was in Spain.      I am a foodie & cannot rave about my brunch experience enough. My Cappuccino was what the Dr. ordered  & my crepe with a mimosa on the side, was phenomenal!       My waiter Nathan was a sheer joy & definitely an asset to this company. I'll be back for dinner & this is my new top recommendation.

JtCL3P9cu_FGprmFXyFI3g.text: Where else can you eat poisonous scorpion fish and live to tell the tale? Really elegant way to spend Father's Day with my two boys, who treated me. It was superb, v rich and yet intriguing mix of flavors with a Mediterranean influence. Service was superb, sit outdoors and enjoy the ambiance

wDRy-UlAsYiS-HY7vhi30Q.text: Ambience is amazing, service spectacular, food too notch, wine yummy and dessert to die for!  This was a perfect place to dine and we are definitely coming back.    My friend and I took the recommendations of our server and it was fabulous!  Octopus, asparagus, lemon spaghetti, scallops,  chocolate/caramel dessert and an after dinner drink I can't remember what it was, lol!
